update.description:
This is for [issue 73](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/issues/73/segway-does-not-delete-job-templates).

```createJobTemplate``` is run in ```run.py``` and never deleted. Failure to delete job templates is explicitly noted by drmaa's [documentation](http://drmaa-python.readthedocs.io/en/latest/drmaa.html) to possibly cause memory leaks. This pull request adds job template deletion to ```cluster/common.py``` and ```cluster/__init__.py```. This may fix the memory leak issues found in [issue 60](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/issues/60/segway-process-uses-too-much-memory).

pullrequest.title: Add job template deletion to cluster/common.py and cluster/__init__.py

content.raw: Turns out the error was occurring because the job template was being deleted regardless of if the job would be resubmitted (and thus reuse the same restartable job template). Solution is to check if job will be resubmitted and then if not, delete the job template.
content.html: Turns out the error was occurring because the job template was being deleted regardless of if the job would be resubmitted (and thus reuse the same restartable job template). Solution is to check if job will be resubmitted and then if not, delete the job template.

pullrequest.title: Add job template deletion to cluster/common.py and cluster/__init__.py

content.raw:
This passed all the simple* tests both locally and on mordor, but I decided to try it out with a larger run just in case. Just got this error:

```
207 critical error: error: lGetElemStr(Nameindex = 1400): run time type error
208 Exception in thread Thread-1:
209 Traceback (most recent call last):
210   File "/mnt/work1/software/python/2.7/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 551, in __bootstrap_inner
211     self.run()
212   File "/mnt/work1/users/home2/rachelc/segway/segway/run.py", line 438, in run
213     self.result = self.runner.run_train_instance()
214   File "/mnt/work1/users/home2/rachelc/segway/segway/run.py", line 2133, in run_train_instance
215     round_index, kwargs)
216   File "/mnt/work1/users/home2/rachelc/segway/segway/run.py", line 2140, in progress_train_instance
217     self.run_train_round(self.instance_index, round_index, **kwargs)
218   File "/mnt/work1/users/home2/rachelc/segway/segway/run.py", line 2092, in run_train_round
219     restartable_jobs.wait()
220   File "/mnt/work1/users/home2/rachelc/segway/segway/cluster/__init__.py", line 292, in wait
221     self.process_job(jobid, job_info)
222   File "/mnt/work1/users/home2/rachelc/segway/segway/cluster/__init__.py", line 254, in process_job
223     jobname = restartable_job.job_tmpl_factory.template.jobName
224   File "/mnt/work1/users/home2/rachelc/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/drmaa/helpers.py", line 159, in __get__
225     sizeof(attr_buffer))
226   File "/mnt/work1/users/home2/rachelc/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/drmaa/helpers.py", line 299, in c
227     return f(*(args + (error_buffer, sizeof(error_buffer))))
228   File "/mnt/work1/users/home2/rachelc/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/drmaa/errors.py", line 151, in error_check
229     raise _ERRORS[code - 1](error_string)
230 InvalidAttributeValueException: code 14: The value for the job attribute is invalid.
```

think it might be because the job template is being deleted before all references to the RestartableJob are gone. However, there doesn't seem to be any other place in the code where the RestartableJob is deleted explicitly, so I don't know where I would put this function call. @ericr86 , where do you think would be a good place to call this?

EDIT: can confirm error is caused by premature template deletion; errors (same error appears multiple times) go away after reverting back to using the ```__del__``` function.
content.html:

think it might be because the job template is being deleted before all references to the RestartableJob are gone. However, there doesn't seem to be any other place in the code where the RestartableJob is deleted explicitly, so I don't know where I would put this function call. @ericr86 , where do you think would be a good place to call this?

EDIT: can confirm error is caused by premature template deletion; errors (same error appears multiple times) go away after reverting back to using the __del__ function.

pullrequest.title: Add job template deletion to cluster/common.py and cluster/__init__.py

content.raw:
According to the documentation linked, ```RestartableJob.__del__()``` would only be called when the reference count of RestartableJob drops to 0, which is what we want (since RestartableJob is the only object that holds JobTemplateFactory, which is the only object that holds the job template). I don't think there would be a case where we would like to delete the job template even if there are other references to RestartableJob (though there shouldn't be). 

Also, I tested on mordor and double deletion of a job template calls a double free, which results in a segfault (which can't be caught the same way as an exception).
content.html:
According to the documentation linked, RestartableJob.__del__() would only be called when the reference count of RestartableJob drops to 0, which is what we want (since RestartableJob is the only object that holds JobTemplateFactory, which is the only object that holds the job template). I don't think there would be a case where we would like to delete the job template even if there are other references to RestartableJob (though there shouldn't be).

Also, I tested on mordor and double deletion of a job template calls a double free, which results in a segfault (which can't be caught the same way as an exception).

pullrequest.title: Add job template deletion to cluster/common.py and cluster/__init__.py

content.raw: We chose to place this function here (within _JobTemplateFactory) since JobTemplateFactory should probably delete its own job template object (rather than RestartableJob deleting it for JobTemplateFactory). So what currently happens is that upon 0 references of Restartable Job, RestartableJob tells JobTemplateFactory that its job template is no longer needed and should be deleted. The alternative is to directly delete the job template from JobTemplateFactory from within RestartableJob.
content.html: We chose to place this function here (within _JobTemplateFactory) since JobTemplateFactory should probably delete its own job template object (rather than RestartableJob deleting it for JobTemplateFactory). So what currently happens is that upon 0 references of Restartable Job, RestartableJob tells JobTemplateFactory that its job template is no longer needed and should be deleted. The alternative is to directly delete the job template from JobTemplateFactory from within RestartableJob.

content.raw:
How does this work in local mode? There's no `segway.cluster.local.Session.deleteJobTemplate()`.

`__del__()` is not guaranteed to be called.
content.html:
How does this work in local mode? There's no segway.cluster.local.Session.deleteJobTemplate().

__del__() is not guaranteed to be called.

content.raw:
Please rewrite this in PEP 8 style i.e. `delete_job_template()`.

Also please add a comment explaining why this is in here even though it is not really a typical "factory" method. (I presume it is because you want to be able to override this for some cluster system.)
content.html:
Please rewrite this in PEP 8 style i.e. delete_job_template().

Also please add a comment explaining why this is in here even though it is not really a typical "factory" method. (I presume it is because you want to be able to override this for some cluster system.)

content.raw:
It indeed seems to fix the memory leak found in issue 60: 

Graph of resident set size (kB) vs Time (2s timesteps) over 19 hours, with job template deletion:

![image.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/a7MnLo/images/870538536-image.png)

Graph of resident set size (kB) vs Time (2s timesteps) over just 2.5 hours, without job template deletion:

![imagecontrol.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/a7MnLo/images/3718677290-imagecontrol.png)
content.html:
It indeed seems to fix the memory leak found in issue 60:

Graph of resident set size (kB) vs Time (2s timesteps) over 19 hours, with job template deletion:

content.raw: Upon searching, I found that the only instantiation of the JobTemplateFactory object is for job_tmpl_factory (line 1897 of ```run.py```), which is then used to create a RestartableJob to be added to RestartableJobDict. There are no other instantiations. The job_tmpl_factory object created is also only put into the RestartableJob object (line 1911 of ```run.py```), no other objects.
content.html: Upon searching, I found that the only instantiation of the JobTemplateFactory object is for job_tmpl_factory (line 1897 of run.py), which is then used to create a RestartableJob to be added to RestartableJobDict. There are no other instantiations. The job_tmpl_factory object created is also only put into the RestartableJob object (line 1911 of run.py), no other objects.

content.raw: Are there any other objects that have an instance of a JobTemplateFactory as an instance? As-in are there different objects representing jobs other than RestartableJob? Those objects would also need to call the `deleteJobTemplate` method of the JobTemplateFactory when those objects are "deleted" as well.
content.html: Are there any other objects that have an instance of a JobTemplateFactory as an instance? As-in are there different objects representing jobs other than RestartableJob? Those objects would also need to call the deleteJobTemplate method of the JobTemplateFactory when those objects are "deleted" as well.
